newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen on sidelines at usual intervention time.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen on sidelines at usual intervention time.

text.p: The Federal Reserve was expected to remain out of the banking system during its usual midmorning intervention period Tuesday, economists said.

The Fed injected reserves on Monday via a round of three-day fixed-system repurchase agreements and permanently added reserves through a coupon pass. Those actions were seen as adding an adequate amount of reserves for the Fed's current needs.
Federal funds were trading at the 5-1/4 percent target rate.
(( -- John P. Hughes, N.A. Treasury Desk, 212-859-1663 ))
